page.title: 04Coming to School on the Bus
page.content: I get on the bus at Pontrilas. We go past St. Mary's Church, Kentchurch, and the drive of Kentchurch Court, which is a big house like a castle. People live in one side of the gatehouse, but the other side is used for storing things. We pick up Tristan at the end of his drive, then we pick up Stephen in Kentchurch. We go past the River Monnow, and we see a bridge that goes over it. One of its supports is very shaky. We go past Demesne Farm and the drive to Lodge Farm. In the summer we see lots of bale hauling and silaging. We meet farm lorries and tractors on the road. We sometimes see a milk tanker that comes to collect the milk from the farms. When we come home in the evening we usually pass the bus taking older children home from the Comprehensive School in Kingstone.
